panel.name: body
panel.component:
<rml:list name="My Design">
!add html design head here!
<rml:item>
!add html design anywhere below!
<rml:label name="Title"/>
<rml:label name="Description" type="multiline"/>
<rml:photo name="Large Photo" size="large"/>
<rml:photo name="Photo Gallery" type="thumbs" main="Large Photo">
!add html design for thumbnail gallery below!
<rml:back design="Button Left"/>
<rml:thumbs size="small" rows="1" columns="3" design="Design 3" select="Design 4"/>
<rml:next design="Button Right"/>
!add html design for thumbnail gallery above!
</rml:photo>
<rml:button name="Details Button" text="View Details" design="Button Design 1"/>
!add html design anywhere above!
</rml:item>
!add html design foot here!
<rml:list/>

1|50|name[
<rml:list>
[definition[RML Type: Design. Contains at least one item with at least one label, photo, or photo gallery.|name[
<rml:item>
[definition[RML Type: Item. Contains the design for one list item. Create multiple items to generate a sequence of unique list items.

IMPORTANT: If you include multiple items within your design, each item must contain the exact same RML elements inside. This includes the <rml:label/>, <rml:photo/>, and <rml:button/> elements.|name[
<rml:label>
[definition[RML Type: Value. Replaced by a value defined by the user when creating items in their list. You can create as many labels as you want within your design for the user to fill out like a form.|name[
name
[definition[RML Type: Attribute. The unique name of your label. If you include multiple labels with the same name, the user will have one textbox in their form that represents the label name, and the value of that textbox will populate all identical labels.|name[
type
[definition[RML Type: Attribute. An optional attribute.

multiline changes the textbox within the form into a multi-line textbox, used to input more than just a few words.|name[
<rml:photo/>
[definition[RML Type: Value or Block. A photo that will be loaded after the user selects a photo from their Media Library when editing their component properties within the Rennder Platform. You can create as many photos as you want within your design.|name[
name
[definition[RML Type: Attribute. A unique name to identify the photo with when the user is editing their component properties.|name[
type
[definition[RML Type: Attribute. Optional. Specifies whether to load a photo or photo gallery.

thumbs: Changes the <rml:photo/> into a Block so you can include a <rml:thumbs/> tag as well as <rml:back/> and <rml:next/> button tags inside of the block.|name[
main
[definition[RML Type: Attribute. Optional. The name of a <rml:photo/> tag to reference as the main photo to use when displaying a photo gallery. This attribute can only be used if you are also using type="thumbs". When clicking on a thumb in a photo gallery, the main photo will load a large version of the thumbnail image.|name[
<rml:thumbs/>
[definition[RML Type: Value. Generates a photo gallery, allowing the user to select photos from their Media Library to populate with.|name[
name
[definition[RML Type: Attribute. A unique name to identify the photo gallery with when the user is editing their component properties.|name[
size
[definition[RML Type: Attribute. The name of the RML Panel design to load the selected thumbnail in.

xsmall : 50 pixel wide thumbnail photos.

small : 75 pixel wide thumbnail photos.

medium : 150 pixel wide thumbnail photos.

large : 320 pixel wide thumbnail photos.

xlarge : 640 pixel wide thumbnail photos.

|name[
rows
[definition[RML Type: Attribute. The number of rows to show for your photo gallery.|name[
columns
[definition[RML Type: Attribute. The number of columns to show within each row for your photo gallery.|name[
design
[definition[RML Type: Attribute. The name of the RML Panel design to load each thumbnail in.|name[
select
[definition[RML Type: Attribute. The name of the RML Panel design to load the selected thumbnail in.|name[
style
[definition[RML Type: Attribute. Optional. Includes a CSS inline-style for each thumbnail within the photo gallery.|name[
<rml:back/>
[definition[RML Type: Button. Loads an RML button design and is used as a paging button for the photo gallery to go back one page.|name[
name
[definition[RML Type: Attribute. A unique name to identify the button with when the user is editing their component properties window.|name[
text
[definition[RML Type: Attribute. The default text to display on the button until the user edits the button title within the component properties window.|name[
design
[definition[RML Type: Attribute. The name of the RML Button design to load for the back button.|name[
<rml:next/>
[definition[RML Type: Button. Loads an RML button design and is used as a paging button for the photo gallery to go back one page.|name[
name
[definition[RML Type: Attribute. A unique name to identify the button with when the user is editing their component properties window.|name[
text
[definition[RML Type: Attribute. The default text to display on the button until the user edits the button title within the component properties window.|name[
design
[definition[RML Type: Attribute. The name of the RML Button design to load for the next button.|name[
<rml:next/>
[definition[RML Type: Button. Loads an RML button design and is used as a paging button for the photo gallery to go back one page.|name[
name
[definition[RML Type: Attribute. A unique name to identify the button with when the user is editing their component properties window.|name[
text
[definition[RML Type: Attribute. The default text to display on the button until the user edits the button title within the component properties window.|name[
design
[definition[RML Type: Attribute. The name of the RML Button design to load for the button.
